column1: The city is an industrial and transportation centre. Manufactured products include processed zinc and lead
The city was founded in 1784 as a fortress during the Russian conquest of the Caucasus and was for many years the main Russian military base in the region. The Georgian Military Highway
column3: was constructed in 1799 to link the city with Georgia to the south
column4: and in 1875 a railway was built to connect it to Rostov-on-Don and Baku in Azerbaijan. Vladikavkaz has become an important industrial centre for the region
